items.title: An epic, interactive guide to Flexbox
items.content:
#‚Äã569 ‚Äî November 23, 2022 | Read on the web

An Interactive Guide to Flexbox ‚Äî A new, interactive explainer from Josh, with over 20 demos showing off how Flexbox works. This is an excellent, detailed overview, and a real sound way to wrap your head around the core flexbox¬†functions. There's a lot to enjoy here and even if you think you know your Flexbox already, it's a great¬†refresher.

Josh W. Comeau

Building Powerful and Faster Data Grid With Kendo UI for Angular ‚Äî Let‚Äôs see how the Kendo UI for Angular Grid can be used to create a robust data grid, and how it compares to Angular¬†Material.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Experimenting with Layering, Filtering, and Masking in CSS ‚Äî Jeff shares some findings following recent experiments with layering, filtering, and masking in CSS. They note that the language has come a long way in recent years, with properties like filter, mask-image, mix-blend-mode, additional gradient types like radial-gradient, and more, opening the door for Photoshop-like effects that weren‚Äôt possible¬†before.

Jeff Zych

A Guide to Keyboard Accessibility with JavaScript ‚Äî The first article in this series looked at HTML and CSS accessibility, and this second entry focuses on JavaScript. It covers a JS toolset you can use to create a great experience for keyboard-oriented¬†users.

Cristian Diaz

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • The 2022 State of JavaScript survey is open and here's what's new.

  • Work with Wordpress? They have a new, official developer blog.

  • The UK's 'Competition and Markets Authority' has launched an investigation into Apple & Google‚Äôs ‚Äúeffective duopoly‚Äù on mobile ecosystems.

  • Sara Soueidan's Practical Accessibility course is open for pre-order.

  • Browser updates:

    • Firefox Nightly and Developer Edition will now support Manifest v3 browser extensions. The latest Firefox Nightly also now has Container Queries enabled.

    • IE 11 will be permanently disabled on certain versions of Windows 10 in February. Prepare for panic from mid-sized corporations and my local¬†library.

    • Safari Technology Preview 158 is out with updates to the web inspector, WebCodecs support, font-size-adjust implementation, API improvements, and more.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Tree Views in CSS ‚Äî How to create a collapsible list (tree view) with just HTML and CSS, no need for JavaScript. Accessibility software will see the tree view as lists nested inside disclosure widgets, and the standard keyboard interaction is supported¬†automatically.

Kate Rose Morley

Create Stunning og:image Tags Automatically ‚Äî Check how you can set up beautiful and dynamic link previews automatically on¬†mugshotbot.com.

Mugshot Bot sponsor

Using Automated Test Results to Improve Accessibility ‚Äî Looks at how to leverage automated test results from accessibility checks to see real, sustainable digital accessibility¬†transformation.

Noah Mashni and Mark Steadman

Inline Layout Switch Ideas ‚Äî Two ideas for animating images from an inline layout to a column or grid-based one ‚Äî¬†and as it‚Äôs from Codrops, there‚Äôs demos of¬†course.

Mary Lou

Improving Firefox Stability with This 'One Weird Trick'
Gabriele Svelto (Mozilla)

A Guide to Image Optimization on Jamstack Sites
Alba Silvente

Taming the Cascade with BEM and Modern CSS Selectors
Liam Johnston

üîß Code, Tools & Resources

media-chrome: Fully Customizable Media Player Controls as Web Components ‚Äî You can see an interactive breakdown of each of the components by hovering over them in the list on the left hand side. GitHub repo.

Mux

Build Custom Automations 10x Faster with Retool Workflows

Retool sponsor

Boxy SVG: An Online, Full-Featured SVG Editor ‚Äî Has a Photoshop-like UI, and can be installed as a PWA and you can use customizable keyboard shortcuts for different¬†features. It does cost money, though, but has a free trial and you can play around with the editor itself without signing up to see if you like the flow.

Jaros≈Çaw Foksa

Random User Generator: A Free, Open-Source API for Generating Random User Data ‚Äî This will return various bits of data in JSON, CSV, YAML, or XML format and includes quite a bit of info for each ‚Äúuser‚Äù, including a profile¬†photo.

RandomAPI

CSS Clothoid Corners: Generate "Visually Softer" Rounded Corners Using CSS clip-path ‚Äî This online generator uses the CSS clip-path property to subtly improve the look of rounded corners on elements. The result is similar to the rounded edges on iOS app¬†icons. ('Clothoids' are also known as Euler spirals. Now you know.)

Takehiko Ono

uiGradients: A Community Contributed Collection of Beautiful Multi-Color Gradients ‚Äî Includes a useful option to rotate any gradient to allow you to customize it before grabbing the code or downloading as a¬†JPEG. I'm definitely feeling Fresh Turboscent (below)..

Indrashish Ghosh

üßë‚Äçüíª JOBS

Senior Frontend Engineer (EU Remote or relocate to Berlin) ‚Äî We‚Äôve built a product thousands of people love (see Trustpilot if you don‚Äôt believe us). We need your help with React &¬†TypeScript.
Feather

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

Ahh.. Fresh Turboscent..

items.title: The evolution of scalable CSS
items.content:
#‚Äã568 ‚Äî November 16, 2022 | Read on the web

The Evolution of Scalable CSS ‚Äî A deep dive into the problems often faced with scaling the use CSS on large projects. You should come away with a good grasp on past approaches, and how popular tools like Tailwind (and others) approach things, for better or worse. ‚ÄúWhatever approach is taken, establishing foundations that bridge the design gap is a key element to scaling¬†CSS.‚Äù

Rem

og:image as a Service ‚Äî Mugshot Bot creates stunning link previews automatically. No more fussing with design tools or wading through thousands of stock photos. Get started for free and take control over your links¬†previews.

Mugshot Bot sponsor

A Guide to Keyboard Accessibility: HTML And CSS ‚Äî A good set of practices and recommendations on how to use HTML and CSS to create a great experience for keyboard users, plus a look at what WCAG criteria we should keep into¬†consideration.

Cristian Diaz

‚ñ∂¬†¬†What's New in WCAG 2.2 ‚Äî An in-depth hour-long look at the recently published Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.2 and the new success criteria. Note: This is at candidate recommendation stage, so is subject to¬†change.

Allison Ravenhall

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • Firefox 107 is out ‚Äî here are the developer-facing release notes.

  • The Safari Web Extensions team is holding an 'office hours' Q&A session tomorrow and you can submit questions to¬†them.

  • Carie Fisher has put together an excellent free digital accessibility course covering ARIA, HTML, color and contrast, and more.

  • The Opera browser has become the first to include a built-in TikTok app..¬†Yay?

  • Rachel Andrews rounds up some of the interesting new features that landed in browsers during October 2022.

  • This timeline shows the evolution of CSS over the past 25 years.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Why You Should Never Use px to Set Font Size in CSS ‚Äî This has been a widely shared maxim over the years, but why? Josh covers this ‚Äúimportant, and poorly understood¬†topic.‚Äù

Josh Collinsworth

Web Sustainability Resources ‚Äî With the COP27 climate summit taking place, Michelle shares some resources for those in the web profession to use when assessing the ecological impact of our¬†work.

Michelle Barker

The Math Behind Nesting Rounded Corners ‚Äî When nesting an element with a rounded corner inside of a rounded container it may not look quite right. Here‚Äôs what to do about¬†it.

Cloud Four

Send Email, Push and SMS with Smart Routing, with Just 8 Lines of Code ‚Äî Send notifications from right within your application using the Courier API. One call, that's all, and send any template to any¬†channel.

Courier.com sponsor

How to Create Advanced Animations with¬†CSS ‚Äî Explains how to create a ‚Äòrollercoaster‚Äô path that a ball follows using cubic beziers and CSS transitions. You‚Äôll also learn how the cubic-bezier function in CSS works in detail and how to stack multiple simple animations to create one complex one. If you‚Äôre just getting started with CSS animation, this is a good¬†primer.

Yosra Emad

Why Are My url()s Not Resolving Correctly When Used as CSS¬†Variables? ‚Äî Reader Andrico sent us this one after seeing some odd behavior around variables and URLs. Here‚Äôs how to ensure your URLs get resolved correctly when used as CSS¬†variables.

Andrico Karoulla

The Anatomy of visually-hidden ‚Äî You‚Äôve probably used visually-hidden content before. But how does the CSS actually work, and why do we use those particular¬†properties?

James Edwards

How to Create Slides with HTML and CSS
Silvestar Bistroviƒá

Classy and Cool Custom CSS Scrollbars: A¬†Showcase
Saleh Mubashar

Software Engineer ‚Äî Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptional¬†engineers.
Stickermule

Senior Frontend Engineer (San Francisco) ‚Äî Build interfaces for an AI-powered research assistant that makes knowledge workers smarter. TypeScript, React,¬†GraphQL.
Heyday

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools & Resources

Bootstrap Icons v1.10.0 ‚Äî Features nearly 150 new icons, bringing the total to nearly 2,000. This release includes rockets, road signs, globes, taxis, and¬†more.

Mark Otto

LocatorJS: Click Any Component to Open Code in Your IDE ‚Äî Available for use as a Chrome or Firefox extension or as a library. You can try it out directly on the tool‚Äôs home page by holding Alt (Option on Mac) then hovering over page¬†elements.

Michael Musil

Shortcut Brings Product and Engineering Together. Try It for Free

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Type Scale: A Visual Type Scale Calculator ‚Äî We've shared this before, but it remains a solid tool worth knowing about. Enter the base font size, select a scale (minor second, major second, etc.), along with a Google font option, and this tool will generate the results visually with copy/paste¬†CSS.

Jeremy Church

html.to.design: Figma Plugin to Convert Any Site into an Editable Figma Design

divRIOTS (Figma Community)

Outstatic: A Static Site CMS for Next.js ‚Äî Very similar to Netlify CMS but specifically for Next.js and Vercel which stores content as files in¬†GitHub. A beautifully designed homepage here,¬†too.

Andre Vitorio

GitHub Unveils Two New Fonts: Mona Sans and Hubot Sans ‚Äî Two variable, open source fonts from GitHub. Here‚Äôs the instructions for getting the variable font features working on your site if you choose to use¬†them.

GitHub

items.content:
Together with¬†

#‚Äã567 ‚Äî November 9, 2022 | Read on the web

Dialogs, Modality and Popovers Seem Similar. How Are They Different? ‚Äî A real deep dive into the semantics, behaviours and characteristics of some of the most common user interface elements of websites today, plus a look at the proposed popover attribute.

Hidde de Vries

The Shared Element Transition API Is FLIPping Cool ‚Äî Chris takes a look at what you can do with the ‚Äútremendously cool‚Äù Shared Element Transition API. With it, you can animate individual elements across different pages even when the browser does an entirely fresh page¬†load. Support is limited and experimental for now, but as a bit of extra visual flair, it may be possible to justify its short-term¬†use.

Chris Coyier

Free Course: The Last Algorithms Course You'll Need ‚Äî This super fun free video course dives into data structures, arrays, search and sort, recursion, graphs, trees and much¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Designing the Perfect Mobile Navigation UX ‚Äî Navigation on mobile can quickly get complicated ‚Äî things like hamburger menus, full-page overlays, animated slide-in-menus, and nested accordions may spring to mind. These options may not always be the best, so this post looks at some alternative design patterns worth¬†exploring.

Vitaly Friedman

Six Steps to Improve Using Images in HTML for Users & Developers ‚Äî A look at how to better serve images for users with responsive sizes and modern formats without making your life as a developer much harder. There‚Äôs ‚ñ∂Ô∏è a video version too if you‚Äôd¬†prefer.

Austin Gil

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • Safari Technology Preview 157 is out with updates to the Web Inspector, CSS, WebCodecs, lots of Web API improvements & more.

  • Got an event to run? You can now register .rsvp domains.

  • Examples of doing huge type on the web successfully.

  • There's a new W3C 'WebDX' community group focused on improving the developer experience around the web platform.

  • The WebXR Augmented Reality module is now a Candidate¬†Recommendation.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Inside the Mind of a Frontend Developer: Building a Hero¬†Section ‚Äî An exploration of how one developer thinks while building a simple hero component, showing (unsurprisingly) the thought process, why a certain solution was selected, and the pros and cons of¬†it.

Ahmad Shadeed

Conditionally Adaptive¬†CSS: Browser Behavior That Might Improve Your Performance ‚Äî Your site might be ready to adapt to any viewport. But Vadim asks why users should wait for irrelevant desktop styles when they load it on¬†mobile?

Vadim Makeev

Shortcut Brings Product and Engineering Together. Try It for¬†Free ‚Äî The best issue tracking software is one that software developers are actually happy to¬†use.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

What CSS Do You Absolutely Have to Know? One Developer's Top Five ‚Äî There may have been a time when it was possible to know most CSS properties and how they work, but Geoff states that those days are long-gone, and asks what CSS do you absolutely have to¬†know?

Geoff Graham

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Keeping Your CSS Small: Scopes, Containers, & Other New Stuff ‚Äî This solid overview looks at a number of new pieces of CSS and DOM technology, both mature and upcoming, all of which help authors manage their CSS and keep things understandable without having to adopt complex new¬†tooling.

Do We Need An Interop for Assistive Technologies?
Hidde de Vries

Managing CSS Styles in a WordPress Block Theme

Mikael √Ösbj√∏rnsson-Stensland

‚òëÔ∏è¬†The WCAG 2.1 Web Accessibility 'Not-Checklist' ‚Äî A guide to make sure you haven‚Äôt missed anything. If you‚Äôre new to accessibility, the resource provides a¬†foundation.

Buildkite sponsor

Content Parser

uiverse

Together with¬†

#‚Äã566 ‚Äî November 2, 2022 | Read on the web

Image via: The Web Almanac

The Web Almanac 2022: Performance ‚Äî Here‚Äôs a recently added chapter to the excellent HTTP Archive Web Almanac for 2022. This new chapter focuses on web performance, specifically looking at Google‚Äôs Core Web Vitals solution, and how its various metrics (LCP, CLS, etc) has impacted the performance¬†conversation.

Melissa Ada & Rick Viscomi

Simplify Front-End Performance Monitoring by Analyzing UX Data ‚Äî Utilize critical performance data to understand how users experience your applications with Datadog Real User Monitoring. Analyze user errors in real-time and resolve front-end issues¬†fast.

Datadog sponsor

The New CSS Media Query Range Syntax ‚Äî The Media Queries Level 4 specification has introduced a new syntax for targeting a range of viewport widths using common mathematical comparison operators, like <, >, and =, that make more sense syntactically while writing less code for responsive web design. This post digs into how things¬†work.

Preethi Selvam

Why One Web Pioneer Thinks It‚Äôs Time to Reinvent The Browser ‚Äî Darin Fisher built the world‚Äôs most popular browsers (Netscape Navigator, Google Chrome) and now he‚Äôs going to try and disrupt them with newcomer¬†Arc.

David Pierce

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • This PDF report looks into the state of digital accessibility in 2022, covering UX, testing, monitoring, inclusive design, and more.

  • A Google engineer has outlined why JPEG-XL support is being removed from Chrome.

  • This Reddit thread asks folks to share the most difficult frontend interview questions they've faced.

  • Ok, this is neat ‚Äî :has makes CSS-powered Connect 4 a thing.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Building an Accessible Tooltip Component ‚Äî A foundational, considered overview of how to build a color-adaptive and accessible <tool-tip> custom element. There‚Äôs a video version of this post if you‚Äôd prefer too. Demo.

Adam Argyle

Typographic Hierarchies ‚Äî Discusses six basic variables to establish a typographic hierarchy, how to look at each differently, and in turn, designs pieces by intentionally modifying each of these variables to create an effective typographic¬†order.

Alma Hoffmann

Understanding WebC Features and Concepts ‚Äî WebC is a recent addition to the Eleventy ecosystem that enables first-class components. Stephanie notes that putting the pieces together may be a little overwhelming, so reviews some WebC features to help us be¬†successful!

Stephanie Eckles

Build Internal Tools 10x Faster with Retool ‚Äî Assemble your UI, connect data, and publish apps faster with Retool. 100+ pre-built UI components. Schedule a demo to learn¬†more.

Retool sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Design Principles For The Web ‚Äî A recent talk on the ‚Äúnever-ending crusade against the unknown‚Äù that is designing and developing on the web. Over the course of ~40 minutes, Jeremy takes a deep look at the design principles we can apply to build sites that are resilient, performant, accessible, and ultimately¬†beautiful.

Jeremy Keith

Motion Controls In The Browser ‚Äî Ever wanted to build a web app that you can control with hand gestures? This article explains how to implement such motion controls, creating an application where you can interact with on-screen elements, using a couple of APIs and some JavaScript. Note: the embedded demo requires a camera feed to¬†work.

Yaphi Berhanu

Getting Color Contrast Right: Actionable Tips On WCAG 2.1 Color Compliance
Lukas Oppermann

Five Visual Treatments that Improve Accessibility
Kelley Gordon (NNG)

‚úèÔ∏è Web Font of the Week

Nabla ‚Äî¬†You may remember a few months back we shared news that the first batch of Color Fonts, using the COLRv1 format, were now available on Google Fonts.

This neat isometric font from Arthur Reinders Folmer and Just van Rossum is one of of the first batch available.

üîß Code, Tools & Resources

Ic√¥nes: An Icon Explorer with Instant Search for 100+ Icon Sets ‚Äî You can select any icon set, then search by keyword within the chosen¬†set. The app is powered by Iconify and built in Vue.

Anthony Fu

Markdoc 0.2: A Flexible, Markdown-based Authoring Framework ‚Äî Markdoc is an extension of Markdown but with extra features you‚Äôll need when working with blog posts or documentation you want to share. It‚Äôs used for Stripe‚Äôs public docs site, but you can bring it into your own systems. GitHub¬†repo.

Stripe

The Component Gallery ‚Äî A collection of interface components from real-world design¬†systems.

Iain Bean

Notification System Design Simplified - UX Matters

Courier.com sponsor

Canvas Confetti: An On-Demand Confetti Shower ‚Äî Ready to let off some fireworks in your browser? Do it in style with confetti. Plenty of demos to check out. GitHub¬†repo.

Kiril Vatev

pinceau: A CSS-in-TypeScript Framework Built for Vue ‚Äî Still in early development, but has the perk of integrating its features seamlessly for Vue developers, and works with Nuxt, Vitesse, and @vitejs/plugin-vue.

Ya√´l Guilloux
